bug.author: thuyen
bug.description:
I am new to chainer and trying to do a custom loop with MultiprocessingIterator. Reproduce on Ubuntu 16.04 and Chainer version 2.0 <denchmark-code>import chainer import numpy as np
dataset = np.ones((10000, 1000)) loader = chainer.iterators.MultiprocessIterator( dataset, 32, n_processes=6, shuffle=True, repeat=True)
while loader.epoch < 1: x = loader.next() print('test') loader.finalize() # hang at worker.join() (randomly, very frequently) </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/niboshi>@niboshi</denchmark-link> Could you try CuPy 1.0.1 as well to see if this problem is related to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/chainer/chainer/issues/3075>#3075</denchmark-link> ?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/delta2323>@delta2323</denchmark-link> I tested in these combinations. This problem is reproduced in both conditions.
Chainer v2.0.2 (v2) - CuPy v1.0.2 (v1) Chainer v3.0.0b1 (master) - CuPy v2.0.0b1 (master)
(Python 3.6.1, Ubuntu 16.04, CUDA 8.0)
Thank you. I will ask them to try master branches for both modules and check the deadlock occur again.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/thuyen>@thuyen</denchmark-link> I tested your code with Chainer v3.0.0rc1. The deadlock does not occur. Maybe, This bug was fixed by <denchmark-link:https://github.com/chainer/chainer/pull/3076>#3076</denchmark-link> . Cloud you check on your environment?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/okuta>@okuta</denchmark-link>
Ah yes, this must have been solved, because <denchmark-link:https://github.com/chainer/chainer/pull/3076>#3076</denchmark-link> includes a test case to check for this issue.
